thread.title: Wenger admits he will consider Arsenal fans’ protests before signing contract
thread.title_full: Wenger admits he will consider Arsenal fans’ protests before signing contract

author: Guardian sport
title: Wenger admits he will consider Arsenal fans’ protests before signing contract
text:
Wenger admits he will consider Arsenal fans’ protests before signing contract • Manager was speaking after the heavy defeat to Bayern Munich • The coach also insisted he had not told players of his decision Arsène Wenger’s Arsenal team next play against Lincoln City in the FA Cup on Saturday. Photograph: BPI/Rex/Shutterstock Wenger admits he will consider Arsenal fans’ protests before signing contract • Manager was speaking after the heavy defeat to Bayern Munich • The coach also insisted he had not told players of his decision View more sharing options   09.51   09.53 GMT 
Arsenal manager Arsène Wenger has admitted he will consider protests by supporters when he decides if he will sign a new contract. 
A number of fans had protested before Tuesday night’s heavy defeat to Bayern Munich and Wenger, speaking at a press conference on Thursday morning, said: “It will not be the most important [factor] but I will consider it of course. It is difficult for me to judge [the level of the protests]. I [have] worked very hard for 20 years to make the fans happy.” 
He also insisted that he had not told his players whether he had decided to extend his contract at the Emirates club. From Highbury to new lows: an Arsenal fan laments missed chances | Toby Moses Read more 
Looking ahead to the game against Lincoln City in the FA Cup this weekend, Wenger said: “I believe that we have two uncertainties - [Danny] Welbeck, who had to come off for sickness, and [Alex] Iwobi on the day of the game could not turn up for the same problem. Everybody else should be available.” 
Wenger said he has not seen reports suggesting that Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain wants to leave Arsenal in the summer. 
He said the player “had been given his chance” at the club. “Personally, I rate him highly and I think I showed that in the way I kept faith in him, even when he was injured.” Topics
